false step, slip, blunder, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__2 defeat, [Refs 1st c.BC+]

vocabInfos.shortDef: trespass, transgression, sin against, to sin as a moral failure to keep a command, figuratively, stepping out of the bounds of God’s law
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
trespass, transgression, sin against, to sin as a moral failure to keep a command, figuratively, stepping out of the bounds of God’s law
primarily a stumbling aside, a false step; in NT a trespass, fault, offence, transgression, Mt. 6:14, 15; Mk. 11:25, 26; Rom. 4:25; a fall in faith, Rom. 11:11, 12
